New York State Moving Violations & Vehicle Crimes
 
Fines and Points.
Note 1: 11 points accrued in an 18 month period results in a suspension of your license.  18 months is calculated from date(s) of offenses.
 
Note 2: Three speeding tickets or other "serious violation" in an 18 month period will result in a revocation of your license.
 
Note 3: Workzone speeding tickets have double fines, points are the same.  Two workzone speeding convictions in 18 months will result in revocation of your license..
 
Note 4: Any driver (NYS or out of state) who accumlates 6 or more points will have a "driver responsbility fee" imposed by NYS DMV.  Fee starts at $300 and increases by $75 for each point above 6.  Fee is in addition to any fines imposed by court. 
 
Note 5: Any conviction for DWAI, DWI or Refusing Chemical Test will cause NYS DMV to impose $750 "responsibilty fee" on driver of $750
 
Note 6: First time DWI is a Misdemeanor crime.  Second DWI in 10 years is a Felony.  First time DWI conviction has mandatory alcohol ignition interlock.

 NOTICE: In compliance with the New York State Attorney's Code of Professional Conduct this website and all information contained within should be considered ATTORNEY ADVERTISING.

Unlike most attorneys I came to the practice of law as a second career. Prior to becoming an attorney I spent 20 years as a business executive, eventually running a large subsidiary of a Fortune 500 company. While those years in private business were challenging and rewarding, there came time that I wanted to do something different and more directly related to assisting other people. So, I left the business world, went to law school, passed the New York State bar exam and became a practicing attorney.  You can read my full bio here and meet our staff here.

 

If you'd like to read what some of past clients have thought of our work, you can read about it here.
